body.name: 4K Digital Camera with Creator Accessory Kit 48MP Remote Control Vlogging Camera for Vloggers Autofocus Flip Screen Photography Cameras with Tripod Grip, Wide-Angle & Macro Lens, Mic, Batteries

features: [ 4K Digital Camera ] This V-CamPro vlogging camera adopted SONY sensor, shooting clear photos up to 48 megapixels and video resolution up to 4K. Supporting 16X Digital Zoom. It is autofocus, tracking object automaticlly to capture clear photos, for close-up shoting, you can also half pressing the shutter for fast focusing.

[ Creator Accessories Kit & Remote Control ] The V-CamPro camera supports remote control within a 5-meter range, and has multiple functions including time-lapse, slow-motion, looping video, self-timer, Continuous Shooting and more. Moreover, this video camera also contains vlogger accessories kit such as rechargeable tripod grip, external microphone, additional wide angle & macro lens, Hot-shoe & threaded double head bracket, and two rechargeable batteries etc., more suitable for content creators.

[ Webcam for Live Streaming ] The video recorder camera can be used as webcam by selecting the "PC Camera" mode after connected to your PC via the USB cable, you can have video calls or start live streaming to share things on social media. So its not only a photo camera for photography but also a streaming camera and video camera for Youtube, Instagram, etc.

[ Flip Screen & Pop-up Flashlight ] This vlog camera has a 3'' flip screen that can be rotated 180 degrees to meet your shooting needs in different poses and realize low-camera shooting, making selfie shooting easier and more fun. And its retractable flashlight system providing the best solution in dim light conditions. When your vision is limited in a dark environment, you can pop up the flash to get a brighter view.

[ Multifunctions Photography Camera ] The video camera has multiple functions. Such as Continuous Shooting, self-timer, flash for taking photos, and time-lapse, slow-motion, looping video for video shooting. Besides, we upgrade the camera to add built-in Macro Mode, so you don't need to add extra Macro Lens. When you display something up to the camera for a close-up, just click the Macro button then the focus repositions.

[ Perfect Gift for Beginners ] The pocket camera has an exquisite looking, is perfect gift for entry-level users who just start in content creation. It is the very affordable vlog camera for creators, vloggers and streamers. Recording travel, sports events, weddings, birthday parties and other activities will be so easy with its help, is an ideal gift for friends, teens and families. If you have any question about the product, please feel free to contact us and we will reply you within 24 hours.

What type of memory card do I need? There are two size memory cards, the larger one named SD card, the small size named MicroSD card or TF Card, this camera takes MicroSD card, supporting from 32GB to 128GB. Recommend to use wellknown brand high speed MicroSD card. How would I transfer videos from the camera to another device like my phone or laptop? Connect the camera to your laptop with the USB cable, select 'Mass storage mode', then you can transfer the photo and videos files, or you can buy a MicroSD card reader with multi-interface which compatible with both laptop and your smartphone. What is the recording time? When connect to the creator tripod, the recording time is approxmetly 2-3 hours when full charge, because there is a power bank inside the tripod. Without the tripod, the recording time is about 30-60min per battery according to the camera usage. How to insert the card and battery? Push the MicroSD card into the card slot in the correct direction until you hear a click sound, means the card installed. If want to remove the card, just push again the card to the end until you hear a click sound, the card will pop out. Can I apply other lenses? Yes. This camera can be matched with 52mm threaded lens, you can apply various lenses or filters to make photography more fun. This camera includes a Macro & Wide-angle 2-in-1 lens.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Holy Cow. This is my dream camera, and I'm wondering where it's been all my life. I didn't have high hopes for this, as I'd tried several budget cameras, and they were always cheezy, and still missing features I really need. This one had those features (microphone input, flipscreen, ability to accept lens filters, shoot at 60fps, etc).A few years ago, I spent 6 times as much as this camera costs, for a big name mirrorless camera, that boasted itself as being the most user friendly camera on the market. It wasn't. Not for me. Ended up getting rid of it. This camera destroys it, at 15 or 20% of the pricetag.The build quality surprised me. Was expecting a cheezy thin plastic body that would break if you yelled at it. Nope. It's built at LEAST as tough as my $600 camera, if not tougher (and I think it is).Love the flipscreen being on top. It's easier and better to look up slightly to see yourself, than to look off to the side, where most flipscreens tend to be located on camera and camcorders.And the display! So clear. I recommend using a variable ND filter. It accepts 52mm filters.Awesome quality picture and video. And so simple to use.The only minor gripe I have, is that it comes with a cheezy strap. But there are some pretty expensive cameras out there that come with cheezy ones, too. Oh, and the lack of any cold or hot shoe mounts. Which can be easily remedied with other accessories. That's it. That's the only thing it lacks in.I recommend this to any beginner to vlogging, videography, or cinematography, especially if you're on a tight budget. This has to be the biggest bang for buck deal in a camera that I've ever seen. Unless you're a seasoned photographer/videographer who has 500 or a thousand bucks to spend on a camera, this is The One. No Joke.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Missing some items
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I think it was supposed to come with a memory card and a remote.. it didn't come with these. Camera looks good.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice Little Camera
reviews.reviewText: This is a nice little camera with pretty decent quality video recording. Its not a high end camera but for this price point you can't expect super high quality. It has bright and crisp looking picture quality. It comes with all the accessories needed to start vlogging. Battery life is pretty good with a couple hours of use and it has 2 batteries. Its not oversized and fits in small bags. Lightweight and pretty easy to operate.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Clever tripod design but camera has no autofocus, short battery life.
reviews.reviewText: This kit is not worth the money; there are better ones at this price. The lack of a memory card is frustrating in an otherwise fully stocked kit, this would be an issue if you buy this as a gift for a kid and they expect to use it out of the box.I didn't even know there were still cameras produced today that lack an autofocus! It's very easy to have it be blurry because you moved out of focus, and this camera is meant to allow you to take footage of yourself. Missing the shot can easily result in a lot of wasted time. I also went through a fully charged battery really quickly. There are a lot of improvements to the display that could help with battery life.The best part about this kit was the lens and tripod. The tripod acts as a power bank which is a clever function that I wish was found on more tripods! The lens itself is solid as well, though there is a perpetual spot that's not from dirt on the lens. These do not carry the kit, unfortunately. The tripod itself might be worth a buy if it were separate.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars I would avoid this.
reviews.reviewText: Unfortunately, I have to say that I'm pretty disappointed with my purchase. The camera is cheaply made and does not perform well.Firstly, the image quality is subpar. The camera produces grainy and blurry images, which is disappointing considering that it's a digital camera. The colors are also washed out and not true to life.The camera's build quality is also lacking. It feels flimsy and cheaply made, and I worry about how long it will last. The buttons are stiff and unresponsive, making it difficult to adjust settings quickly.The camera's user interface is confusing and difficult to navigate. It's not intuitive, and I found myself struggling to figure out how to adjust basic settings like the flash and timer.Finally, the camera's battery life is abysmal. I had to replace the batteries multiple times during a short photo shoot, which is unacceptable.Overall, I regret purchasing this off-brand digital camera. Its image quality is subpar, the build quality is lacking, the user interface is confusing, and the battery life is abysmal. If you're looking for a quality digital camera, I would recommend looking elsewhere.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This camera is very beginner friendly. The flip screen is very much needed when vlogging. The auto focus works well. It’s lightweight and compact enough to always have with you on the go.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Doesn’t seem like colors are great and kind of grainy
reviews.reviewText: I ordered this camera to try and make YouTube cooking videos. The camera feels and looks decent upon initial unboxing. I wanted a camera with a flip up view to see what I am recording in real time. After some testing with this camera, it’s not as nice or high quality picture as I would have wanted. The recorded video colors seem to be a little on the yellow/red side and also the picture is a little grainy and does not seem to be very HD. The focus seems too fragmented and not smooth when zooming in, more like 10% increments instead of gradual. I am used to using an iPhone so was expecting a pretty nice recording from this, but I may just stick with the phone recordings for now. Overall the camera seems a little cheaper then I expected and not sure I’ll use this to produce my videos. I will update if I can figure out a way to make the videos look better. It may be a lighting issue because I was recording without the best lighting but I’m not hopeful that will correct all of my quality issues.
